Posts.Content: Tkane10 wrote: I had a mammogram 12/1 which showed a spiculated lesion. I was assured by the radiology department that it was “just scar tissue” due to my previous breast reduction years ago. I use to be an oncology nurse and knew spiculated rarely was good, i declined there first recommendation to wait 6 months and repeat mammo And US. Breast biopsy was done on 12/20 was called on 12/26 confirming what I already knew. I was scheduled and had surgery 1/8, unfortunately one of the margins were not clean. I had another surgery on 1/22 which cleared all margins. Oncotype came back at a 12, genetics negative. left breast stage 2A ILC. One node showed isolated cancer cells but was considered negative. I am schedule for a radiation consult 1/8. Although I have a strong Oncology background i still find myself researching everything, wondering if i should have had a mastectomy, is not doing chemo ok. I do trust my oncologist but can’t stop my anxiety at times. Dx 12/26/2017, ILC, Left, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 1/7/2018 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 1/21/2018 Radiation Therapy 2/20/2018 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed Tkane10 msphil

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2018 09:12AM Tkane10 wrote: Veeder14, I feel hot not just my breast. It’s 30 degrees out and my heat is on 60 and that is more than enough. At times even that is uncomfortable for me.
Posts.Title: MARCH 2018 starting RADIATION Veeder14 Beaverntx

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2018 08:44PM Tkane10 wrote: I just had 12/33 Friday. I am so hot, like really hot. My heat is on 60 and I still feel it’s to hot in my house. I don’t have a fever, it started pretty early on with radiation And just continues to get worse. Has anyone else experienced this
Posts.Title: MARCH 2018 starting RADIATION Veeder14 Beaverntx

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2018 06:08PM Tkane10 wrote: I started February 21st, I’ve had 7/33,missed treatment #8 due to a snow storm that left us wth 40 inches of snow, so That will be added on at the end. The last 7 will be boosts. I am doing the breath hold since I am being radiated on my left side. I was told to use pure aloe for the first 2 weeks then pure aloe mixed with aquaphor for the last 4 weeks. My breast is already red and fatigue has been horrible since the 2nd treatment although I am not sure if that is mostly due to the 100 mile round trip.
Posts.Title: MARCH 2018 starting RADIATION Veeder14 Beaverntx

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2018 11:47PM Tkane10 wrote: Tomorrow is #8 of 33. I have yet to have a full week of treatment. I am having such a hardback time with radiation, fatigue was almost instant, I was also placed on keflex due to a possible breast infection. I feel like my treatment Days are just that. My appt time is 945 but after making the 100 mile round trip i am to exhausted to be productive the rest of the day.
